intro: Crucihimalaya virgata, commonly known as the Himalayan crucifix, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many economically important crops such as cabbage and mustard. The plant is characterized by its distinctive cruciform (cross-shaped) flowers, which are typically white or pale yellow. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine meadows and rocky slopes. Due to its unique morphology and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists alike.
